page.title: 09LAW AND JUSTICE (II)
page.content: {SOLICITORS}IN BIDEFORD REPRESENT THE CRIMINALS IN{COURT.}ONE SOLICITOR STATED THAT IN{1984}CLIENTS WERE AGED {BETWEEN 15_85}YEARS. CASES TAKE{1 WEEK {TO 2 YEARS}TO COME TO COURT. THEY DEALT WITH 5 CRIMINAL CASES PER WEEK AND CIVIL CASES SUCH AS DIVORCE WHICH TOPPED 100 CASES. THE{REGISTRAR}SITS MAINLY IN {BARNSTAPLE}FOR{CIVIL}CASE BUT COMES TO {BIDEFORD}ONCE A MONTH. HE DEALS WITH CIVIL CASES SUCH AS{DEBT, DIVORCE, {MAINTENANCE, BOUNDRY DISPUTES, BAD {WORKMANSHIP}AND{SMALL CLAIMS.} PEOPLE WHO EVADE OR DO NOT PAY TAXES, RECEIVE{APPLICATIONS}FROM THE {TAX COLLECTOR}TO PAY THE REQUIRED AMOUNT. NON PAYMENT CAN RESULT IN THE TAX COLLECTOR MAKING AN APPLICATION TO COUNT FOR SEQUESTATION OF GOODS. HE IS THE ONLY NON LEGALLY QUALIFIED PERSON WHO MAY PRESENT A CASE IN COURT.
